questions.question: Which space exploration site in Central Asia launched the first manned mission to orbit Earth on April 12, 1961?
questions.context: This site became famous for sending Yuri Gagarin into space, making him the first human to orbit the Earth.

questions.question: Which famous museum in France holds the world's largest collection of Impressionist paintings since its opening in 1986?
questions.context: Originally a railway station, this museum features masterpieces from artists like Claude Monet and Vincent van Gogh.

questions.question: Which capital city in the Nordic region is known for its stunning harbor and the Little Mermaid statue unveiled in 1913?
questions.context: Recognized for its vibrant cultural scene, this city is also home to Tivoli Gardens, one of the world's oldest amusement parks.

questions.question: At which dark tourism site in Ukraine did a catastrophic nuclear disaster occur on April 26, 1986, leading to mass evacuations?
questions.context: This site is associated with the worst nuclear accident in history, and has been the subject of films and documentaries.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin near the modern city of Amman, Jordan, showcases Roman engineering with its grand colonnaded streets and intact amphitheater?
questions.context: Known for its well-preserved Roman architecture, this site is one of the largest and most complete Roman towns outside Italy.
